advisory: Seedling stage: To manage stem borer in paddy at early stage, use Trichogrammajaponicum card @ 1/acre at weekly interval for 6 times.
Vegetative stage: To manage stem rot, drench soil with Validamycin 3% L @ 400-ml/acre or Captan 70% + Hexaconazole 5% WP @ 300-gram/acre.
Planting stage: Select resistant varieties to prevent red rot disease. Soak setts for 30 minutes in a solution of water containing carbendazim, chlorpyriphos, and urea.
Vegetative stage: To manage powdery mildew disease, spray Sulphur 80% WP @800-gram/acre or Hexaconazole 5% E.C @ 300 ml/acre.
Vegetative stage: To manage powdery mildew disease, spray Sulphur 80% WP @800-gram/acre or Hexaconazole 5% E.C @ 300 ml/acre.
Vegetative stage: To control cut worm, spray Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5% E.C @ 400 ml/acre.
Vegetative stage: For controlling mites, spray Ethion 50% EC @ 600 ml/acre.
Vegetative stage: Prevailing fog condition may increase aphid infestation. To control aphid, spray neem oil formulation or Flonicam.
Vegetative stage: To manage purple blotch and Stemphylium leaf blight disease, spray Mancozeb 75% WP or Difenoconazole 25% E.C at 15 days interval.
Flowering stage: To control black spot disease, spray Copper Oxy-chloride 50% WP.
As the temperature of the surface water is colder than the bottom layers, the fish prefers to live in the bottom zone. Keep water depth up to 6 ft for hibernating in the warmer bottom zone.
